page.title: 07ARTS AND CRAFTS.
page.content: { Newlyn boasts the oldest artist's colony in the country.The first painter's to find their way to Newlyn were Walter Langley and Edwin Harris. They came in 1882 and the Newlyn colony quickly grew. Possibly the most famous of them all was Stanhope Forbes who arrived early in 1884.Other major artist's beside's Forbes who joined the Newlyn colony were Ralph Lodel,Henry Scott Tuke, Fred Hall T.C. Gatch, Elizibeth Armstrong (who later married Forbes) Norman Garstin Frank Bourdillon and Henry Rheam. These artists shared a set of ideals. Most of them were admirers of the French realist painter Bastien Lepage, and they followed him in depicting everday scenes of village life and painting where possible on the spot.
